title: Can we talk about Cassiopeia .. yet again Riot?
body:
It has become evident to many pre-rework Cassiopeia players that their once beloved snake lady has been reduced to nothing but mere ashes ever since her uncalled for rework. 

**Riot has made it abundantly clear on many occassions that they ...**
1. Have no idea what they want Cassiopeia to even be as they've attempted to turn her into a late game hyper carry but neglect the fact she's an immobile mage that relies on poisons and 
2. Have had no real care about Cassiopeia since her rework and arguably even before it.  

**But never mind the fact this rework is a colossal failure and has been since its release on many different factors, never mind the fact that Riot has given a giant middle finger F U to dedicated Cassiopeia players that have given solid feedback to this "rework", let's dicuss why Cassiopeia is a massive flop yet again. **

____

**Probably the biggest problem with Cassiopeia that has been stated so many times at this point my human brain cannot fathom the number is that it takes TO LONG FOR HER TO BE USEFUL. ** Riot has gone out their way to turn Cassiopeia into a late game hyper carry but have completely made it so that her late game hyper carry scaling is depended on a time passive that takes forever to stack, is completely boring in every sense of the word, and unnecessary for the same exact reason. Meanwhile actual hyper carry's like Veigar, Azir, Ryze etc can reach their late game power spike faster and in some cases offer MORE then what Cassiopeia can in a shorter time frame. 

____

**Cassiopeia's core identity has been completely butchered for some man's hard on for stacking passives. ** Cassiopeia's core identity use to be one thing no matter how you played her and that was - debilitation: weakening her enemies downed. But ever since this joke of a passive has been introduced nearly all of her AP ratios have been completely gutted to compensate for the massive amounts of unneeded AP she'll receive later on in the game. What you're left with is a champion that is pretty damn shallow and is nothing but a pathetic shadow of her former self. I kid you not, I have had mid laners literally **stand inside my miasma and laugh because the damage is that pathetic it's taunt worthy and I don't blame them.** When you have a champion who's poisons, which are core to the kit, are such a goddamn joke that the only threat they offer to your opponent is causing them to start choking on their sour patch kids because of how laughable the damage output is you know something is wrong. 

____

**Cassiopeia is continually neglected. ** There is absolutely not debate here, this is the most **NEGLECTED REWORK EVER.** There have been countless ideas on how to improve Cassiopeia to make her overall a healthier champion and more fun experience in the game, but all of this has been neglected. Hilariously, even the person that reworked her has, for a majority of the rework, completely ignored her fan base and did whatever the hell he saw fit and had in his insane little mind. Why Riot has completely decided to abandon Cassiopeia for so long is beyond me, but I still find it pretty pathetic that they have done this to her player base when all we've asked for is someone to fucking look at her and fix the problems we list over and over. Is that so much to ask for Riot? A champion we've grown attached to and purchased every skin for, enjoyed countless hours on, and crafted memories with to simply be made somewhat viable again and less of a colossal piss off whenever you play her? 

____

**Cassiopeia's rework was never called for. ** I personally cannot think of one time when anyone ever has stated that Cassiopeia needs a rework, literally whenever I would ask someone what they would change about Cassiopeia (pre-rework anyway) I would always get a reply along the lines of QOL changes, fixing her ultimate, and maybe making miasma a little bigger so its somewhat more of a threat in large team fights. But nonetheless, I've **never heard anyone say that Cassiopeia needed a rework** and now that I think about it I believe that Cassiopeia, pre rework, was probably one champion that was one of the most least complained mid laners in the game if not the most. This rework was a colossal turd that was melded into a rework and presented to us as if we are suppose to take it seriously and just live with it, but I can't do that anymore. 

____

**Riot, it's time to give Cassiopeia a full relaunch or either revert her back to her pre-rework state and work from there. ** You don't think her play style is healthy? Fine, relaunch her into something entirely different as long as she keeps debilitation in her kit I won't mind but keeping this piece of trash in the game is blatant disrespect to her fans and a slap in the face to anyone that has loved Cassiopeia since release. 

Sincerely, 

A disappointed Cassiopeia player.

replies.body:
> relaunch her into something entirely different as long as she keeps debilitation in her kit I won't mind

What does "debilitation" mean to you? I see suggestions like this come up from Cass players pretty often, but it's usually not followed by much more than wanting DoTs to be emphasized on the kit, and Twin Fang to be de-emphasized. Do keep in mind I'm not saying this is incorrect. However, I do hope that if we were to do poisons or "debilitation" better, it would manifest in a way that wasn't just stronger DoTs. Unique debuffs? Time delayed afflictions? More CC? Is it simply that you want your Q to be stronger in lane?

Please do keep it civil from this point forward. I'm interested in what's going on here, minus a lot of the aggressive nature (though I understand it to a degree, to be fair).

Well the first thing you could do is to add some improved visibility to champions affected by poison - Cass, Twitch, Teemo and Singed would definitely love that. Simply giving poisoned champions a purple lifebar during the duration of their ailment would be the first best step to improve the overall experience, and it wouldn't even be an issue balancewise.

Now if we're talking gameplaywise, you'd definitely need to put more focus on the rest of her kit. Being dependent on spamming a single ability isn't very interesting, especially if said ability is extremely limited in its usage due to extreme manacosts, restricted range and the fact that you have to stand still to even cast it. 

By either increasing the ratios on her other abilities or by allowing them to stack with each other (as some sort of combo-system) would make them so much more enjoyable to use. By putting more emphasis on her skillshots you'd also make her far more healthy, those skillshots happen to be her poison abilities. Oh, also PLEASE try making her ultimate more reliable to use this time - it's an unholy mess right now due to its short range and awful cast-delay. Heck, just by putting a poison-effect on it you'd make her far more viable at following up.

Also we aren't angry at you (well, not with you at least, but I can't guarantee the same for Stashu), we're simply disappointed that Cassiopeia and her issues have been left untouched for so long. We're merely asking for some tweaks to bridge the time until that rework finally is ready which is probably going to take half a year, that's simply too long for us if we're planning to play this champion until then. Meddler already commented on that possibility during last year, it's too bad he didn't come back to it.

> We're merely asking for some tweaks to bridge the time until that rework finally is ready which is probably going to take half a year, that's simply too long for us if we're planning to play this champion until then.

It's not exactly what you're asking for, but I put in some changes to Cass this last week that should make her no longer cancel her Movement or Attack orders when casting Twin Fang. It's not something that could ever be data-mined, so it may not appear on PBE, but it should be there. Assuming it gets through QA bug-free, it should be there for 6.2. For those unfamiliar, this treatment was also given to Ryze a few patches after his release, and it seemed to make his play a bit smoother.

Sounds neat, I wonder how that one's going to turn out. Also how about that QoL-change for the lifebars like I mentioned earlier? That shouldn't be too much of an issue, could it be?

What we'd like to see the most right now would be some reversals on past nerfs, she'd need either her manacosts lowered or her sustain increased. That alone would help her a lot at reaching lategame and becoming the hypercarry she's supposed to be - being stuck with a 50% winrate after 40 minutes isn't exactly "hyper".

> Also how about that QoL-change for the lifebars like I mentioned earlier? That shouldn't be too much of an issue, could it be?

That sounds like something that new tech would need to be created for, so it doesn't seem like a quick easy thing at the moment, unless there's an internal workaround that could do it that I'm spacing on.

> What we'd like to see the most right now would be some reversals on past nerfs, she'd need either her manacosts lowered or her sustain increased.

I'm not really one to field buff requests, sorry. If there was something about her gameplay that mechanically wasn't functioning, I may be in line to help in the immediate, but despite her low win rate in solo queue, the fact that Cass saw pro play as recently as this week does suggest she's not incredibly far off from a pure power level perspective.
Kinda tired of Riot flip flopping on whether seeing pro play means a champ is healthy or not.
Balance and health aren't really the same thing. Champions can be balanced without being healthy, and they can be healthy without being balanced.
Right, that was my bad. What I meant was whether pro play means a champ is BALANCED or not.

>**suggest** she's **not incredibly far off** from a pure power level perspective.

(emphasis mine)

How do you think they're flip-flopping, exactly? Repertoir is just saying that her seeing pro play means she probably isn't trash.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1IUQUyxT,comment-id=000c0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-19T00:11:15.976+0000)
> the fact that Cass saw pro play as recently as this week does suggest she's not incredibly far off from a pure power level perspective.

Why are you guys so inconsistent and hypocritical? If the amount of play a champion sees in tournaments is how you want to balance champions, why have you not heavily nerfed the champions that have been getting played in every single game for the past year (let alone the past 2 or more)? Why have you not heavily buffed the champions that have never seen any real play?

You know as well as I do that a champion's strength is not determined by how much tournament play that champion sees. The rest of Riot knows that, too. The rest of the playerbase knows that, too. No one else will admit it, but I don't care about that. If you're going to balance based off of popularity in tournaments, then do it. If you're not, then don't. You (Riot) have to pick one, though.

> If the amount of play a champion sees in tournaments is how you want to balance champions, why have you not heavily nerfed the champions that have been getting played in every single game for the past year? Why have you not heavily buffed the champions that have never seen any real play?

Because we don't take such a binary approach to the matter.

Regardless, it would be great if this conversation could move back toward directional changes for Cassiopeia, and away from game balance. I came into this thread with the objective of learning what kinds of directional changes players are interested in for Cass.

Well, we want a poison mage. And that's very vague, and the discussions don't get past that for one reason or another. Communication is a two way street, but the upset from her fans is understandable even so, right?

Power fantasy/general sh'tuff below:

Okay, so, we want a poison mage. That can mean a lot of things. First is that Cassiopeia's poison abilities ought to have impactful damage. But, for me, it's about the poison being powerful, one way or another. At least personally, my fantasy is to see Cassiopeia's poisons slowly, but **surely,** eating away her opponent's health bar. Her poison abilities, at least IMO, do not necessarily have to have big AOE, low cooldowns, etc. but **they need to be powerful on their own instead of just enabling her E spam.**

One thing I thought of was trying to capture what a "snake" champion would be. Like, what about having Cassiopeia chip away with her poisons... Q...W...Q->E...W... QEEEEEEEE! And then, once their low, all in them with Twin Fang. So, she hangs back until her opponent is weakened, and then she makes her move. That would be snakelike... Granted, I don't know how to do that, but it would be really cool to be able to incorporate a power fantasy like that. And, maybe it would work to entice both sides of her fanbase that like the poisony aspect as well as the side which likes her DPS with her Twin Fang. Assuming her kit's all the same. Maybe a partial/full rework is in order. (But maybe not too)
---------------------------------------------------------------------

Balancey/Specific Stuff:

Cassiopeia's current passive is crap. It exists solely to prevent her from reaching her power. It feels terrible because you can't even interact with it. It's just... there. Other hypercarries are gated by items, and hell, so is Cassiopeia. She doesn't need this gated timer to cripple her for 40 minutes on top of that. It feels awful because it's just something you wait around for.

Not to mention, it's incredibly undynamic compared to other "Evolution" passives. You can't choose WHAT to evolve, (Viktor/Kha'Zix) and nothing actually evolves either. You just get... stats. (Her passive IS a ball of stats, btw. Because Riot doesn't like those)

I think Rengar has a similar passive with his Bonetooth necklace, but he has another passive to go along with it, right? If you want to keep this passive, there should be another passive that Cassiopeia can utilize and interact with throughout the game.

As for her kit itself...  there's not much to say since it functions much like it did before. Just want a kit that has it's power more easily spread out. Her poisons should be as strong, if not stronger, than her E.
--------------------------------------------------------------

...And, on the whole, Cassiopeia is portrayed as a very sly, even shrewd character. She's also very cunning and manipulative too. Deceptive. Her lore and VO paint her as such. Her VO also has her talk mostly about her poisons. It doesn't make much thematic sense for her to be a brawley, in your face, 1 v 1 kind of champion. She should be about wearing away her opponents, and striking when they're weak.

> Her poison abilities, at least IMO, do not necessarily have to have big AOE, low cooldowns, etc. but they need to be powerful on their own instead of just enabling her E spam.

This seems to be a pretty common opinion I've read. Thanks for posting!

You're not responding to most of the comments about possible directions for Cass.

You're responding to the game balance questions.
That's fair. I'll try to hit those from here forward.

So people have mentioned more DOT gameplay (which I completely agree with), but what I'd really like to see is her to get a new passive. It's limiting her and gating her immensely. Instead of just straight poison though, how do you feel about an a spreadable poison? I'm thinking along the lines of, if a poisoned target comes in contact with an ally (or minion), the poison spreads. You could have a small circle appear around them that shows the distance they must be apart for clarity reasons.

I think her q (as well as karthas's q) should have an indication on how wide it should be before you release the button as well as not casting UNTIL you release the Q. I know that will help out on some people new to cass. 

her W should do something more than just slow. This is the era of mobility with a majority of champs played in LCS have either a dash, blink, or some ways to just tank the minor damage she's throwing out. 

her R should be more than just a Stun/slow. 

her E should be more than just "Spam this when target is poisoned"  a lot of the other mages have some sort of feel when it comes to their kit  (annie has to cast 4 spells of anything to do her 100-0 tibbers BS, anivia has a wall to keep you in her ult for longer and her e interacts with her ult and Q, etc) 

I really think that she should be more of a poison mage than a "spam E" maybe have her E refresh the poison on a target or something cause right now, cass will give you carpal tunnel in order to even play her decently.

> I really think that she should be more of a poison mage than a "spam E" maybe have her E refresh the poison on a target or something cause right now, cass will give you carpal tunnel in order to even play her decently.

Yeah, it seems like there's a pretty consistent desire for a little more intricacy in how E is used.

She's basically AP urgot right now, and that doesn't bode well for health or enjoyment.

And it's something that's been a point of contention since the very beginning.

I'm an avid Cassiopeia player and I have loved her since her released despite the fact that she really was less than stellar upon her initial release. I have played her quite a bit and I wouldn't say I'm an amazing player, probably about average but an above average cassiopeia player. Despite putting in  nearly 500+ games on her, I still feel weak as hell and as if I can't really do anything on her and thats probably a combination of her poor design and clunky feel.

I think Cassiopeia's design is just fundamentally flawed. The intent of the cassiopeia rework was actually pretty cool, but in terms of practical gameplay I think it just absolutely disintegrates. She is a mid range mage, with zero mobility, a clunky kit, squishy as hell, and has a horrendous early game.  Just from a gameplay sense, this won't ever really be viable for the majority of players. She requires near perfect play to truly reach the pinnacle of gameplay and for the vast majority (like 99.5%) of players it's not obtainable and she fails completely flat on her face. 

It's been said numerous times, but her Noxious Blast and Miasma absolutely need to be buffed, she cannot survive as a champion if these only serve to facilitate her Twin Fang which is her lowest range ability. Not to mention it's very unreliable; Twin Fang reset also calculates travel time, so the further you are away the slower the reset. Given that Miasma poison only lasts for 2 seconds and Noxious Blast for 3 seconds, it only really allows you get off 3 casts of Twin Fang assuming you are max range before you need to reapply poison. If someone were to flash or dash away after you land a poison and twin fang, the travel time actually makes it so that your Twin Fang can end up on cooldown depending on the distance they gain and your travel time. Basically the poison dissipates before you get the reset. This is hugely consequential to her gameplay and actually makes it very difficult for her to get meaningful damage off on some champions or follow up on a kill. 

If her kit is going to be entirely based around the twin fang then she probably needs a bigger window in which she can cast it. I understand the difficulty in balancing this, for example the Twisted Fate gold card nerf a while back is along the same lines; I understand riot doesn't want you to be able to sit on a poison for long periods of time and force people off a wave, but the simple fact that you can only get out 2 or 3 Twin Fangs at maximum per Noxious Blast or Miasma landed is extremely problematic. 

It may seem strange that I consider Cassiopeia a mid-range mage given that her Q is 850 range, W is 850 range, E is 700 range, and ult is 850 range but in game they feel considerably smaller. But given that her Q and W do absolutely nothing in terms of damage, and travel time is a factor in her E reset, she constantly finds herself creeping further and further into fights to do any meaningful damage. Just consider popular champions such as elise or jax. Jax's Leap Strike (Q) is 700 range, Elise Cocoon is 975 range, Morgana Binding 1300 range, etc. Cassiopeia's main damage dealing spell exposes her to getting blown up instantly more often than not. I understand there is a skill component to consider, but she is just so vulnerable so often and to get meaningful damage out she exposes herself even more. 

I think the utility on these spells could also use a buff. Landing a Noxious Blast grants a 20% movement speed increase for 3 seconds. It is hardly a factor at all, it's such a minor buff for such a short duration that it hardly enables her to kite or chase people down. Her Miasma slows for 25-45% for 2 seconds, again hardly a factor in her ability to peel for herself or slow enemies down. The slow duration is just too short for such a minor slow. Just consider this slow in comparison to other champion's, for example Lulu's glitterlance or Miss Fortune's Make it Rain, or whatever other slow you want to compare it to. Most other slows in the game are either substantial in slow with short duration or substantial in duration with lower speed reduction, Cassiopeia's Miasma is neither or those. If I'm completely honest, both her Noxious Blast and Miasma are utter garbage both in terms of the damage and utility they bring. They only serve to facilitate her usage of Twin Fang which is just a horrible design.

Her ultimate could also use some tweaks. It feels really clunky and unresponsive. I think the cast time is nice for animation canceling the wind-up with flash, but ultimately it's kind of unnecessary. It seems like it has a cast time with a very long animation which delays it more than most champions ultimates. I cannot even count the number of times I've been instantly blown up (full 100-0) while trying to get this ultimate off, I just don't think the long wind up and cast time are necessary. In addition, her ult's base damage is incredibly low with very low ratio's not to mention how gimmicky it is. Her rank 1 ultimate does 150 base damage with a .5 ratio. Compare that to let's say Syndra's rank 1 ultimate which does 270 minimum base damage (+ 90 damage per sphere) at a .6 ratio. I just think her ult needs some major quality of life changes and touch-ups.

Finally her passive is just so counter-intuitive to the direction the game has been heading since season 2. 500 stacks of Aspect of the Serpent is actually extremely difficult to achieve and for most people it probably won't come online until 35 minutes at the earliest but most likely 40+ minutes into the game. This just seems so delayed, especially for a meta that see's most gametimes average 27-29 minutes (at least at pro play) and especially considering her ratio's are balanced around 500 stacks. If you were to not poison a single enemy the entire game it would take 50 minutes to reach 500 stacks. I know this isn't practical considering you will absolutely land poison's some of the time, but consider that your Miasma and Noxious Blast only last 2 and 3 seconds, they really don't accelerate your stacks that much unless you are consistently landing your poison which you may not always be able to do. Also consider that poisoning multiple players does not accelerate the rate at which you gain stacks. You can land Noxious Blast on 5 enemies at once, but you will only gain 3 stacks of Aspect of the Serpent. 500 stacks is just way too many, 400 would probably be much more appropriate given that the length of games is going down and that other threshold for stacks are 100 and 250. 500 stacks makes it a huge gap between 250 and 500. This is particularly troublesome because this is generally long after laning phase and the ability to consistently generate stacks from enemies is extremely diminished. It makes jumping from the second (250) threshold to the third and final (500) stack threshold so difficult.

The passive 25% CDR seems completely out of place. Not only because it gives an odd amount of CDR that you're required to take at least 5% from runes to round it off (not that you would want to), but also the fact that CDR is a relatively weak stat on cassiopeia. Her Noxious Blast is a base 4 second cooldown at all ranks and her Twin Fang is a base 5 second cooldown at all ranks, not to mention it resets on poisoned targets. So really the 25% CDR only facilitates her ultimate which does have an absurdly long CD relative to it's power and her Miasma which as we have highlighted is pretty much a non-factor in her kit. I feel like you could just replace the CDR with another stat such as spell pen or spell vamp and she would actually see a lot more use out of it. The 25% CDR feels very out of place on a champion who has very low base cooldowns and her damage frontloaded on a spell that resets. 

I think the Cassiopeia rework was really cool and looked exciting on paper, but it just absolutely does not translate to realistic gameplay. She has way too many fundamental flaws with her kit and lacks the power to make up for these massive flaws. Yes, she can be one of the highest damage mages in the game, but if she instantly gets blown up 100-0 or can't get in range or can't consistently deal damage, it's just not practical. Cassiopeia needs to be balanced around what she can realistically do not the utmost extreme potential that she very often never reaches.

That may be true but there's a huge difference between Solo Q play and actual competitive LoL with professionals who function on a whole different level while having access to full team voicechat. You can't exactly balance a game around an extreme minority, what about the rest of the people who play this game? Shouldn't this be your target-audience?

When the discrepancy between those is too great, we run into issues, issues that are a frequently a reason for doing Champion Updates. Ryze has some of this going on at the moment, where his allowable power is regulated by the fact that he's a competitive power pick despite being sub par for most players.

What about {{champion:268}}'s current state? He got nerfed to the ground over and over and now all his counters got buffs with either the new AD items or thunderlords giving champions like {{champion:7}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:99}} way more damage. It was always said they allowed his low win rate in solo queue because he was so strong in competitive, when right now he's unheard of in competitive play from what I've seen this season.

I wasn't a Cass main by any means pre-rework (I can't main a champion, gets boring after a while) but she was by far one of my favorite champions. What I liked the most was building Rylai's and Liandrie's on her. I can't even really say whether it was the best build or not, but when you hit those Qs it really *felt* like you were poisoning someone, like you your poisons were debilitating. 

As far as I am concerned, that's what I'd wanna see again. Poisoning your enemies and seeing them slowly melt. That's the feeling I wish a designer could capture and put back in the game. How? I'm not sure. Having her Q and W apply cool debuffs could definitely be a way to do that. The point is, at the end of the day, it makes no sense for Cassiopeia to gain something from attacking her enemies (passive stacks to ascend, honestly this should be thrown out the window, regaining mana and health with her E why is that there?). This forced thematic of Cassiopeia gaining things is only there so she can somewhat function as an AD carry-esque mage yet her kit does not truly work. Only time it did was when she was blatantly overtuned.

Instead, Cassiopeia's enemies need to lose things when she interacts with them. They should lose HP of course. They could also lose other stuff. She's supposed to be a poisoner. Make her one. Make her spread her curse. Allow her to deteriorate everything she touches. And because she's an opportunist, when she's done weakening her targets, she will strike, slithering in close range and sinking her fangs into her enemies. Well, there's always the tried and true **Slow** or **Defense Shred**/**%Damage-Amp** one can see all over. However, I just had an idea... a truly insidious one.

_________________________________

**Cooldown Increasing** poisons. As in, when a target is poisoned, their abilities (not **Summoner Spells** and probably not **Item Actives** or **Passives**) take longer to recharge. You should be fearful of being poisoned, and being poisoned should actually increase your danger. Armor/MR shredding affects Tanks much more than a Carry, and if the poison lowered Damage Output that would put her into a more anti-carry role. Cassiopeia should still want to poison -_**everyone**_-.

Actually, I at first envisioned a **-Healing** and **-Mana Regen** effect, but I feel the **-CDR** would be better balance wise (cause not everyone even uses mana, or their mana usage hangs more precariously than the Sword of Damacles). A snake and/or poisoner weakens their target before actually beating them. By increasing her enemies' cooldowns (I'd say never more than 10-12%, maybe a scaling based on the abilities' original CD??), they will heal less, bolster their defenses less, save their allies less, cast less and so on. They would become wary standing near the snake, as anyone should.

This would shift her from Ryze 0.5; a machine gun Mage that has poor split push and little relative safety. She would approach what probably fits closer to the poison/snake Mage people think of when they see her for the first time (and want her returned to :3 ).

Caveats and additions:

* The CDI (Cooldown Increasing) shouldn't be a constant thing. Something akin to Yasuo's dash timer or Udyr's Stun per target should be applied to this. This not only gives both players the proverbial "window of engagement/decision making" that Riot oh-so loves, but it creates another lever for the Live Balance team to tune and fiddle with. 


* This should probably not be affected by Tenacity, though I can see the reason and arguments for why it in turn should be.


* There is also the option of adding in an Attack Speed Debuff so non-caster ADC's have something to worry about.


* Cass's current passive just seems to be bad design. A Snake doesn't grow stronger because it's poisoned people, and in general, it doesn't seem Poison Magey to grow in power for having poisoned someone for a second 20 minutes ago.


* Abilities that make charges (and Karma's R) should get a weaker application of the +CDI. In almost all cases, these abilities are not only the 'bread and butter' for the champion, but are entirely balanced on the idea that they'll get multiple uses in quick succession in an engagement. Mostly, I'm just worried about Heimer turrets and Vi E's (and my Teemo shrooms!). Karma would/should get this too as her R is so crucial to her relative effectiveness.

________________________

I don't think she's in an awful spot. She doesn't take forever to scale, she's just a squishy midrange sustained damage dealer that's played in the lane/land of burst and high range. She has her strong lv. 2 powerspike, but she often has a hard time after that. 

That said, I agree that her ways to apply poison are too similar (ground-targeted skillshots) and that her E holds too much weight both in her gameplay and her kit (while being the least charachterizing spell). In my mind a solution would be to reverse the situation and going from "Poison enables Twin Fangs" to "Twin Fangs enables Poison". This means that her two poison abilities should apply a debilitating effect + DoT damage and her E should enhance them as if it was ripping through the weakened flesh of her poisoned enemies and worsening their conditions, allowing the poison to spread even more. 

Ideas for debilitating effects are: 

1) *Slow*. Poison often implies reduced mobility up to complete paralysis. Her poison might apply a slow (perhaps also to attack speed) that, enhanced by E, would end up rooting+disarming the enemy. 

2) *Shred* . Poison often implies vulnerability. Her poison might apply a MagicRes shred + stackable (%missing health) DoT that, enhanced by E, would bring the dps of her poisoning abilities to secure death for her opponents (unless they have a QSS/Zhoonya).

3) *Confusion* . Poison often clouds judgement and vision. Her poison might apply vision restriction with the vision field getting more narrow as you get stacks of poison with E (this doens't seem very funny on the receiving end, but I'm just throwing off ideas). Reaching a certain cap, you get *charmed* by Cassio.

The idea of a Charm in Cassiopeia's kit feels very compelling to me, especially since her old VO went so hard on the venomous seductress vibe. It would also combo with her R since you would have a reliable way to apply the stun of Petrifying Gaze (balanced by the fact that you would have to hit your poisons and apply a certain number of stacks - I imagine 4 would be cool - thus giving 2/2.5 secs to your opponent for reaction).
